From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin fundāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [funˈda]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [funˈdaɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

fundar (first-person singular present fundo, first-person singular preterite fundí, past participle fundat)(transitive)

  1. to found, to establish
  2. to base (en on)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of fundar (first conjugation)

gerund fundant

singular fundat fundada
plural fundats fundades

conditional fundaria fundaries fundaria fundaríem fundaríeu fundarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella

vós 		ells/elles

affirmative — funda fundi fundem fundeu fundin
negative (no) — no fundis no fundi no fundem no fundeu no fundin

Related terms

[edit]
  • fundació
  • fundador
  • fons

Further reading

[edit]
  • “fundar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025

Icelandic

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

fundar

  1. indefinite genitive singular of fundur

Interlingua

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

fundar

  1. to found

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of fundar

participle present perfect
fundante fundate
active simple perfect
present funda ha fundate
past fundava habeva fundate

Old Norse

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

fundar

  1. genitive singular indefinite of fundr

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese fundar, fũdar, from Latin fundāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /fũˈda(ʁ)/ [fũˈda(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /fũˈda(ʁ)/ [fũˈda(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /fũˈda(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /fũˈda(ʁ)/ [fũˈda(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /fũˈda(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /fũˈdaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /fũˈdaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /fũˈda.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

fundar (first-person singular present fundo, first-person singular preterite fundei, past participle fundado)

  1. to found, establish

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of fundar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

Future fundar fundares fundar fundarmos fundardes fundarem
Imperative
Affirmative funda funde fundemos fundai fundem
Negative (não) não fundes não funde não fundemos não fundeis não fundem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • fundo

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin fundāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /funˈdaɾ/ [fũn̪ˈd̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: fun‧dar

Verb

[edit]

fundar (first-person singular present fundo, first-person singular preterite fundé, past participle fundado)

  1. to found

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of fundar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive fundar
gerund fundando
past participle masculine feminine
singular fundado fundada
plural fundados fundadas
singular plural

vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

[edit]
